column2: 1. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column6: using the inside rearview mirror.
column8: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column4: Church ahead
column6: Intersection ahead

column4: may follow each other.
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 5. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Warning signs
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 6. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: improve your driving performance.
column6: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column4: Lane shifting
column6: Two-way Traffic

column2: 8. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column4: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column6: Train intersection

column4: Merge
column6: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column4: for yeild signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column10: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column4: No U-Turn
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 13. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column4: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column6: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way

column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column4: No right turn
column6: Keep right

column2: 17. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.

column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column10: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.

column2: 19. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: signal.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 20. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: presence of a yield sign.
column6: number of cars behind you.
column8: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column10: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 21. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column6: You may not turn right
column10: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column4: can increase your stopping distance.
column6: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 23. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column6: tend to be more aggressive.

column4: Divided highway ends
column6: One-way traffic
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column6: You must come to a complete stop

column4: No Passing Zone
column6: One-way street

column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: improves your reaction time.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column10: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 28. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column4: a reduction of lanes sign.
column6: a right curve sign.

column2: 30. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.

column2: 31. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 32. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 33. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column4: steady green
column6: flashing green

column4: change lanes.
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column4: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column6: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 36. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers are not required to stop.
column8: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column10: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.

column4: Lane ends
column6: Divided highway ends

column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 39. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column6: apply the brake and slow down.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 40. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
